body_html:
I ran into the same issue trying to setup an EC2 machine. Although deviceQuery ran fine, nvidia-smi would run halfway then crash the first time then hang on subsequent tries. I also tried running the Theano test which hung the same way as TensorFlow.

Ultimately I stumbled on https://devtalk.nvidia.com/default/topic/880246/cuda-7-5-unstable-on-ec2-/ which points to CUDA 7.5 as the issue. When I switched to CUDA 7.0 at least Theano would work. That nvidia forum thread has some directions at the end that might get 7.5 working.

body:
I ran into the same issue trying to setup an EC2 machine. Although deviceQuery ran fine, nvidia-smi would run halfway then crash the first time then hang on subsequent tries. I also tried running the [Theano test](http://deeplearning.net/software/theano/tutorial/using_gpu.html) which hung the same way as TensorFlow.

Ultimately I stumbled on https://devtalk.nvidia.com/default/topic/880246/cuda-7-5-unstable-on-ec2-/ which points to CUDA 7.5 as the issue. When I switched to CUDA 7.0 at least Theano would work. That nvidia forum thread has some directions at the end that might get 7.5 working.
